SHOP BULK & SAVE!!! Who We Are The name ‚ÄúSmitten‚Äù embodies our aspiration for customers to experience delight with every purchase and use of our products. We are committed to utilizing high-quality ingredients, as we believe that investing in your hair, skin, and body is essential for overall well-being. We have expanded our presence throughout the most of South Africa, and we aspire to reach a global audience in the future. We take great pleasure in engaging with our customers and offer personalised support via WhatsApp during our operating hours. When you choose Smitten SA you choose an experience guaranteed to delight. Meet The Team | South Seas Data SOLUTIONS SIR Device Monitor Custom Windows 10 and Linux Interface Replacement Software Development Services Media Destruction DEPOT Depot Services ABOUT Leadership Team CONTACT SUPPORT Select Page South Seas Data Leadership Schedule An On-Site Visit TIM MILLAR VICE PRESIDENT & GENERAL MANAGER As the Vice President and General Manager for South Seas Data, Tim is responsible for the development and expansion of South Seas Data Depot products and services. He has more than 20 years of experience in the Operations and Business Development channels. Tim joined South Seas Data in 2002 and has been responsible for the growth, implementation, and migration of new and existing customers utilizing South Seas Data proven business solutions and practices that integrate with each part of a customer‚Äôs organization. LinkedIn ANTHONY MUSSER VP OF TECHNOLOGY Anthony has been with South Seas Data since 2005. He has over two decades of experience in software development and design, as well as image management, cloud services and desktop implementation and IT services. As the technology head at South Seas Data, he¬†responsible for tracking and managing all software projects and imaging projects, and coordinating Cloud Services to implement and support cloud customers, as well as maintain and support the cloud services infrastructure. LinkedIn MIKE CURIEL SR. NETWORK ENGINEER Michael joined South Seas Data in 1997, he brings three decades of broad range of experience, technical skills and management experience. At South Seas Data, he oversees all networking, security, SSD servers and support to the corporate office as well as their branch office located in St. Louis, MO. While maintaining and supporting the IT operations at South Seas Data, Michael has maintained 99.988% uptime for the network over the last 15+ years. LinkedIn Aaron Alwell NATIONAL BUSINESS DEVELOPMENT & SALES MANAGER A Sales, Business Development, and Marketing veteran, Aaron joined SouthSeas Data in 2025. He brings with him an impressive record of success establishing brands and driving growth in a wide variety of industry verticals and markets. With almost two decades of experience both in consumer and B2B products, services, and solutions, Aaron possesses a broad skill-set as well and leadership qualities to engage new business and achieve company goals. LinkedIn Chris Williams SR. MANAGER PROJECT, PURCHASING & SUPPORT OPERATIONS Chris has been with South Seas Data for over a decade. As the Sr. Manager Project/Purchasing/Operations, he works closely with customers to design solutions for all of their projects from inception to completion. He also maintains relationships with all vendors, channel suppliers and manufactures. He oversees day-to-day operations for inventory, receiving, data entry and technical repair teams. His primary goal is to ensure our customer‚Äôs always have product stocked, staged and ready to fulfill all of their business needs. LinkedIn DALLAS VOIGT SR. MANAGER PROJECT, FULFILLMENT & SUPPORT OPERATIONS Dallas has been with South Seas Data for nearly two decades. As the Sr. Manager Fulfillment/Quality Assurance/Operations, he manages the client teams day-to-day flow of product and service quality assurance and the shipping and fulfillment department. He also oversees the CSR teams, managing the flow of information for customer inquiries and resolutions. Additionally, he also is the project lead for several key accounts. LinkedIn Kyley Kendall CSC & PROJECT MANAGER Kyley joined South Seas Data in 2007 as a Customer Service Representative and in 2008, she moved to the Order Administration team. Kyley is instrumental to the success of South Seas Data‚Äôs customer support and account management. She has been leading the Customer Service Department since 2016 and recently added a Project Manager to title in 2022. LinkedIn South Seas Data LLC 8536 Concord Center Drive Englewood, CO 80112 info@southseasdata.com Local: (303) 799-1500 Toll-Free: 1(888) 773-2656 Facebook X Instagram ¬©2025 - South Seas Data LLC | All Rights Reserved | Privacy Policy

This is the unofficial web site for the owners of: Harbourview Villas Plantation Bay Villas Plantation Beach Club Plantation House South Seas Club The Cottages at SSP I also welcome whole owners at South Seas Island Resort. Let this site be your virtual gateway to the islands of Sanibel and Captiva, South Seas Island Resort and the individual associations. I encourage you to use this web site for the valuable and timely information it offers about your vacation resort ‚Äì add it to your list of favorites or make it your homepage! If you are an owner please register with this site to qualify for more features. Some of these include association documents, bulletin board postings and the ability to submit classified ads. Please Contact Me if you have any questions. Hans DeVaughn Southseastimeshares.com is not affiliated with South Seas Island Resort (SSIR), the individual management companies (including Hilton Grand Vacations) or the individual Associations located on South Seas Island Resort. South Seas Data | LinkedIn Skip to main content LinkedIn Top Content People Learning Jobs Games Sign in Join now South Seas Data IT Services and IT Consulting Englewood, CO 476 followers Business Technology Solutions Follow Discover all 54 employees Report this company About us South Seas Data LLC was founded in 1992 in the Denver metro area (Englewood, CO) to provide high-quality technology service solutions to a wide range of North American businesses. With deep expertise and preferred contract pricing on offerings from top manufacturers for computer systems, devices, terminals, kiosks and hardware, we can manage the full lifecycle of equipment, including acquisition, imaging, software installation, and custom-kitted product deployments, as well as all the needed maintenance and upgrades. Additionally, our skilled teams possess the expertise and processes to support your deployments with unmatched SLAs, itemized tracking, detailed logistics reporting, and a highly customizable managed services designed to enable complex fulfillment to geographically diverse locations. To find out more about South Seas Data and our suite of solutions, please visit SouthSeasData.com. At South Seas Data, we know that in today‚Äôs fast-paced world, customers expect two things: lightning-fast delivery and unmatched support ‚Äî and that's exactly what we deliver.
Why Our Clients Choose South Seas Data:
 ‚úÖ Industry-Leading Response Times ‚Äì From inquiry to order, we streamline the process to get you what you need, faster.
 ‚úÖ Personalized Customer Service ‚Äì Real people. Real support. We‚Äôre here when you need us, not just when it‚Äôs convenient.
 ‚úÖ Reliability You Can Count On ‚Äì On-time, every time. Because your deadlines are our deadlines.
We don't just meet expectations ‚Äî we exceed them. Experience the difference of a partner who‚Äôs as committed to your success as you are.
Let‚Äôs talk about how we can accelerate your supply chain and elevate your service experience. 
Warehousing, Integration projects, Distribution with Valuable deployment options and Great Shipment Rates all contribute to a cost savings solution with South Seas Data's expertise. #CustomerServiceExcellence #FastDelivery #TimeToOrder #B2BSuccess #SouthSeasData #Distribution #Realpeople #Custom #Solutions 7 Like Comment Share South Seas Data 476 followers 6mo Report this post Thank you Citizen Systems! Their dedication and expertise have been invaluable, and we look forward to continued success together for years to come! We are ready to provide you project cost and show how we can make a difference for your organization.

Privacy Policy | Family Resort Fort Myers, FL | South Seas Skip to main content 866-565-5089 BOOK NOW Homes of Distinction Vacation Rentals Close Stay Offers Homes of Distinction Vacation Rentals Itineraries Club Captiva Experiences Bayview Pools Dining Captiva Landing Golf Water Sports Recreation Event Calendar Marinas Gather Weddings Meetings Social Celebrations Real Estate About Coming Soon The Shops at South Seas Gallery Resort Map Getting Around Tarpon Tournament Blog News & Press Community Information BOOK NOW Homes of Distinction Vacation Rentals BOOK NOW Homes of Distinction Vacation Rentals Privacy Policy Effective Date: May 27, 2022 Scope of this Privacy Policy We are delighted that you are visiting this website and have an interest in Timbers Resorts. Before proceeding you should be aware of what this Privacy Policy applies to and what it does not. This website is owned and controlled by Timbers Resorts. (‚ÄúTimbers,‚Äù ‚Äúwe,‚Äù ‚Äúour,‚Äù ‚ÄúCompany‚Äù). It is also applicable to and may be used by the individual hotels, resorts and conference centers that we manage within the United States. This Privacy Notice explains who we are, how we collect, share and use Personal Information, and how you can exercise your privacy rights. Timbers Resorts is an independent hotel management company. Hotel owners entrust us to operate their hotels and to provide exceptional service to guests at a global portfolio of both franchise-branded and independent hotels, resorts, conference centers. This website contains links to websites for specific hotels that are managed by Timbers Resorts. In most instances, these websites are operated by the associated hotel brands (e.g., Hilton Worldwide, Marriott International, Inc.). This Privacy Policy applies to this website only. We are not responsible for the data collection, data use practices, privacy policy or the use of cookies or tracking technologies on hotel brand websites or other non-Timbers websites that you may access from this website or that have directed or connected you to this website. In addition, if you choose to engage with Timbers Resorts on a social media platform such as Facebook, LinkedIn, You Tube and Google+, this activity is conducted at your own risk and without any expectation of privacy as Interstate does not control these platforms. Also, Timbers Resorts cannot control the actions of other users of any social media platform and is therefore not responsible for any content or submissions contained on such sites and platforms. Introduction We understand you may have questions about how we collect and use the information that you provide to us and the privacy of your Personal Information. To be clear, by Personal Information, we mean data that could be used to identify or contact you, including, for example, your name, address, telephone number, e-mail address, or any other information that can be linked or is linkable to you. The privacy of your Personal Information is very important to us. We respect the privacy of every individual who visits this website and provides any Personal Information to us. If you ever have any privacy questions or concerns please contact us via email or postal mail at: [email¬†protected] Timbers Resorts Attn: Marketing Department 5400 Plantation Road, Captiva Island, FL 33924 If you do not agree to the collection and use of your Personal Information as described in this Privacy Policy, please do not provide us with any information and cease using this website. Browsing this Website You may browse this website anonymously. Similar to many websites, our web server logs maintain a record of every device‚Äôs Internet Protocol (IP) address, type of device you are using, and browser type (e.g., Internet Explorer, Firefox), Internet Service Provider (ISP), that accesses this website along with the date, time and length of time you spent on this website. We will not associate this information with any Personal Information about you. This information is used for website usage analysis as described in the Google Analytics section of this Privacy Policy. If you are a resident of a member nation of the European Economic Area or the United Kingdom , click here to learn about how we collect, share and use your Personal Information, and how you can exercise your privacy rights. Information We Collect on this Website and How We Use It We collect only basic Personal Information about you such as your name, e-mail address, telephone number, and any other information you choose to provide so that we may process your requests such as contacting you about hotel development opportunities. In addition, if you choose to sign-up to receive e-mail updates we will use your e-mail address to send you the requested information. All required and optional information is clearly denoted on any form presented to you. If you provide us feedback or contact us via e-mail, we will collect your name and e-mail address, as well as any other content included in the e-mail, in order to send you a reply. Cookies This website makes limited use of ‚Äúcookie‚Äù technology. Cookies are strings of text a website stores on a user‚Äôs computer. This website uses one or more persistent first party cookies to know when you are a return visitor to this website, which web pages you visited on the website and the sequence in which you accessed the web pages. Persistent cookies remain on your computer hard drive until you delete them or are otherwise removed upon expiration. First party cookies are set directly by Interstate and are not used for advertising or any other purpose than previously described. The cookies we use do not contain any Personal Information and we do not use cookies to ascertain any Personal Information about you. Cookies do not corrupt or damage your computer, programs, or computer files. You can manage your cookie acceptance or blocking preferences and deletion through your web browser. ‚ÄúDo Not Track‚Äù Requests/Signals This website does not support, nor respond to, ‚Äúdo not track‚Äù or similar technical requests. Google Analytics We use Google Analytics to help us analyze how visitors use the website. The tool uses cookies to collect standard Internet log information and visitor behavior information. The information generated by the cookie about your use of this website, including your IP address, is transmitted to Google. This information is then used to evaluate visitors‚Äô use of the website and to compile statistical reports on website activity for us. We do not use the statistical analytics tool to track or to collect any Personal Information of visitors to our website. We do not seek to link an IP address with the identity of a computer user. If you do not want any information to be collected and used by Google Analytics, you can install an opt-out in your web browser. Google‚Äôs ability to use and share information collected by Google Analytics about your visits to this website is restricted by the Google Analytics Terms of Service and the Google Privacy Policy . Careers at Timbers Resorts Timbers Resorts uses a private label database and tools hosted by a third party to collect information from individuals who wish to be considered for potential employment. Please note that there is a similar but separate Privacy Policy for the Careers web pages. Sharing Your Personal Information We do not sell or otherwise make your Personal Information available to any third parties for their own use. We do use third parties to perform services such as (i) hosting this website and the Careers website and systems, (ii) storing Personal Information you expressly provide to us, (iii) storing and processing information about the use of this website, and (iv) sending you emails with your permission. These service providers are contractually prohibited from using any Personal Information for their own use. They were engaged to provide specific services and the use of any Personal Information they have access to will be dictated by us. We may also share your Personal Information in the following circumstances and the receiving party will assume the rights and obligations regarding your Personal Information as described in this Privacy Policy: To third parties that you authorize to receive such information. With our subsidiaries, joint ventures, or other companies under a common control (‚ÄúAffiliates‚Äù), in which case we will require our Affiliates to honor this Privacy Policy. In connection with or during negotiation of any merger, financing, acquisition or dissolution, transaction or proceeding involving sale, transfer, divestiture, or disclosure of all or a portion of our business or assets. In the event of insolvency, bankruptcy, or receivership, Personal Information may also be transferred as a business asset. In addition, we may disclose your Personal Information without your permission if we are: compelled by law or court order to act differently; required or elect to notify you of a security breach; or directed by a government entity to provide Personal Information to support an investigation and we believe in good faith that providing the information is necessary to investigate or protect against harmful activities to or by our customers, website visitors or property. Securing Your Personal Information We understand that the security of your Personal Information is important. We use a variety of industry-standard administrative, technical and physical controls designed to protect your information. No method of transmission over the Internet, or method of electronic storage, is 100% secure, however. Therefore, while we use reasonable efforts to protect your Personal Information, we cannot guarantee its absolute security. Accessing Your Personal Information You are in control of the Personal Information that you provide to us. If you would like to access any Personal Information we maintain about you please contact us at [email¬†protected] . Children‚Äôs Privacy This website is not intended for use by children and we do not knowingly collect any Personal Information from children. Anyone under the age of 13 is prohibited from using this website. Legal Issues This is a United States website subject to laws of the United States and is not intended for users outside of North America. However, if you are located outside of North America, by visiting the website and providing us with Personal Information, you acknowledge and agree that your Personal Information may be processed for the purposes identified in this Privacy Policy. In addition, your Personal Information may be processed in the country in which it was collected and in other countries, including the United States, where laws regarding processing of Personal Information may be less stringent than the laws in your country. By providing your Personal Information you consent to such transfer. However, if you are a resident of a member nation within the European Economic Area or the United Kingdom, click here to learn about how we collect, share and use your Personal Information, and how you can exercise your privacy rights. If you reside in the State of California, you have the right to request from us a list of third parties with whom we shared Personal Information about you for their own direct marketing purposes during the previous calendar year. Please note, however, we do not share Personal Information with unrelated third parties for their own use. If you have any questions, please contact us at [email¬†protected] . Changes to this Privacy Policy We may change this Privacy Policy over time. When changes are made we will post the effective date of the changes in the Privacy Policy and provide a link to the previous version so that you may review any changes. As a resident of a member nation of the European Economic Area or the United Kingdom, you have particular rights concerning your Personal Information. This section of our Privacy Policy describes: what information we collect how we collect it how we use it the security measures we take concerning your Personal Information whether it is shared and with whom your rights concerning your Personal Information What Personal Information does Timbers Resorts collect and why? We may collect your name, e-mail address, telephone number, and any other information you choose to provide so that we may process your requests such as contacting you about hotel development opportunities. All required and optional information is clearly denoted on any form that you are presented. If you provide us feedback or contact us via e-mail, we will collect your name and e-mail address, as well as any other content included in the e-mail, in order to send you a reply. The Personal Information that we may collect about you broadly falls into the following categories: Information you provide voluntarily We ask you to provide certain information voluntarily. The types of information we ask you to provide, and the reasons why we ask you to provide it, include your contact details in order to make a reservation, book or purchase one of our services, subscribe to marketing communications from us, and to submit enquiries to us. We will also ask you to provide your credit card details so that we can charge you for any purchases that you make during your stay at the hotel. We will also collect your hotel loyalty card number so that we can communicate with the hotel to ensure that you collect points for your stay at the hotel. If we ask you to provide any other Personal Information not described above, then the Personal Information we will ask you to provide, and the reasons why we ask you to provide it, will be made clear to you at the point we collect your Personal Information. Information we collect automatically We may also collect certain information automatically from your device. In some countries, including countries in the European Economic Area, this information may be considered Personal Information under applicable data protection laws. Specifically, the information we collect automatically may include information like your IP address, device type, unique device identification numbers, browser-type, broad geographic location (e.g. country or city-level location) and other technical information. We may also collect information about how your device has interacted with our website, including the pages accessed and links clicked. Collecting this information enables us to better understand the visitors who come to our website, where they come from, and what content on our website is of interest to them. We use this information for our internal analytics purposes and to improve the quality and relevance of our website to our visitors. Some of this information may be collected using cookies and similar tracking technology, as explained further under the heading ‚ÄúCookies and similar tracking technology‚Äù below. Information we obtain from third party sources From time to time, we may receive Personal Information about you from third party sources (including travel agents that have made a booking on your behalf), but only where we have checked that these third parties either have your consent or are otherwise legally permitted or required to disclose your Personal Information to us. The types of information we collect from third parties include your name, address, email, credit card rewards number and stay history. We use the information we receive from these third parties to honour your reservation. With whom does Timbers Resorts share my Personal Information with? We do not sell or otherwise make your Personal Information available to any third parties for their own use. We do use third parties to perform services such as (i) hosting this website and the Careers website and systems, (ii) storing Personal Information you expressly provide to us, (iii) storing and processing information about the use of this website, and (iv) sending you emails with your permission. These service providers are contractually prohibited from using any Personal Information for their own use. They were engaged to provide specific services and the use of any Personal Information they have access to will be dictated by us. We may disclose your Personal Information to the following categories of recipients: to our group companies, third party services providers and partners who provide data processing services to us, or who otherwise process Personal Information for purposes that are described in this Privacy Notice or notified to you when we collect your Personal Information; to any competent law enforcement body, regulatory, government agency, court or other third party where we believe disclosure is necessary (i) as a matter of applicable law or regulation, (ii) to exercise, establish or defend our legal rights, or (iii) to protect your vital interests or those of any other person; to a potential buyer (and its agents and advisers) in connection with any proposed purchase, merger or acquisition of any part of our business, provided that we inform the buyer it must use your Personal Information only for the purposes disclosed in this Privacy Notice; to any other person with your consent to the disclosure. Google Analytics: We use Google Analytics to help us analyze how visitors use the website. The tool uses cookies to collect standard Internet log information and visitor behavior information. The information generated by the cookie about your use of this website, including your IP address, is transmitted to Google. This information is then used to evaluate visitors‚Äô use of the website and to compile statistical reports on website activity for us. We do not use the statistical analytics tool to track or to collect any Personal Information of visitors to our website. We do not seek to link an IP address with the identity of a computer user. Google‚Äôs ability to use and share information collected by Google Analytics about your visits to this website is restricted by the Google Analytics Terms of Service and the Google Privacy Policy . Legal basis for processing Personal Information Our legal basis for collecting and using the Personal Information described above will depend on the Personal Information concerned and the specific context in which we collect it. However, we will normally collect Personal Information from you only where we have your consent to do so, where we need the Personal Information to perform a contract with you, or where the processing is in our legitimate interests and not overridden by your data protection interests or fundamental rights and freedoms. In some cases, we may also have a legal obligation to collect Personal Information from you or may otherwise need the Personal Information to protect your vital interests or those of another person. If we ask you to provide Personal Information to comply with a legal requirement or to perform a contract with you, we will make this clear at the relevant time and advise you whether the provision of your Personal Information is mandatory or not (as well as of the possible consequences if you do not provide your Personal Information). Similarly, if we collect and use your Personal Information in reliance on our legitimate interests (or those of any third party), we will make clear to you at the relevant time what those legitimate interests are. If you have questions about or need further information concerning the legal basis on which we collect and use your Personal Information, please contact us using the contact details provided under the ‚ÄúHow to contact us‚Äù heading below. Cookies and similar tracking technology We use cookies and similar tracking technology (collectively, ‚ÄúCookies‚Äù) to collect and use Personal Information about you, including to serve interest-based advertising. For further information about the types of Cookies we use, why, and how you can control Cookies, please see our Cookie Notice. How does Timbers Resorts keep my Personal Information secure? We use appropriate technical and organizational measures to protect the Personal Information that we collect and process about you. The measures we use are designed to provide a level of security appropriate to the risk of processing your Personal Information. Data retention We retain Personal Information we collect from you where we have an ongoing legitimate business need to do so (for example, to provide you with a service you have requested or to comply with applicable legal, tax or accounting requirements). When we have no ongoing legitimate business need to process your Personal Information, we will either delete or anonymise it or, if this is not possible (for example, because your Personal Information has been stored in backup archives), then we will securely store your Personal Information and isolate it from any further processing until deletion is possible. Children‚Äôs Privacy This website is not intended for use by children and we do not knowingly collect any Personal Information from children. Any resident of the EEA or UK who is under the age of 16 is prohibited from using this website. Your data protection rights You have the following data protection rights: If you wish to access, correct, update or request deletion of your Personal Information, you can do so at any time by contacting us using the contact details provided under the ‚ÄúHow to contact us‚Äù heading below. In addition, if you are a resident of the European Union, you can object to processing of your Personal Information, ask us to restrict processing of your Personal Information or request portability of your Personal Information. Again, you can exercise these rights by contacting us using the contact details provided under the ‚ÄúHow to contact us‚Äù heading below. You have the right to opt-out of marketing communications we send you at any time. You can exercise this right by clicking on the ‚Äúunsubscribe‚Äù or ‚Äúopt-out‚Äù link in the marketing e-mails we send you. To opt-out of other forms of marketing (such as postal marketing or telemarketing), please contact us using the contact details provided under the ‚ÄúHow to contact us‚Äù heading below. Similarly, if we have collected and processed your Personal Information with your consent, then you can withdraw your consent at any time. Withdrawing your consent will not affect the lawfulness of any processing we conducted prior to your withdrawal, nor will it affect processing of your Personal Information conducted in reliance on lawful processing grounds other than consent. You have the right to complain to a data protection authority about our collection and use of your Personal Information. For more information, please contact your local data protection authority. (Contact details for data protection authorities in the European Economic Area, Switzerland and certain non-European countries (including the US and Canada) are available here .) We respond to all requests we receive from individuals wishing to exercise their data protection rights in accordance with applicable data protection laws. Updates to this Privacy Notice We may update this Privacy Notice from time to time in response to changing legal, technical or business developments. When we update our Privacy Notice, we will take appropriate measures to inform you, consistent with the significance of the changes we make. We will obtain your consent to any material Privacy Notice changes if and where this is required by applicable data protection laws. How to contact us If you have any questions or concerns about our use of your Personal Information, please contact us using the following details: [email¬†protected] 5400 Plantation Road, Captiva Island, Florida 33924 Email: [email¬†protected] Reservations: 1-866-565-5089 Real Estate: 1-800-669-0508 Weddings & Groups: 1-800-282-3402 Stay Club Captiva Experiences Gather Real Estate About FAQ Join Our Email Newsletter Connect with South Seas to receive updates on exciting resort developments and promotions. South Seas Plantation Resort Vacation Condo Rentals | Sanibel Island, Florida Rentals Email 800 794-3107 Home Rental Complexes Rental Request One Bedroom Rentals Two Bedroom Rentals Three Bedroom Rentals Captiva Island Sanibel Island Island Info Beach Cams Island FAQ Island Directory Map/Directions Things to Do Sales South Seas Plantation Resort Vacation Condo Rentals More than 600 luxurious units, ranging from deluxe hotel rooms and villa suites to three-bedroom beach homes and cottages. 5400 Plantation Rd, Captiva, FL 33924 ‚Äì Full Service Resort Captiva Island ‚Äì Where You Get Everything You‚Äôre Looking For Captiva is a tiny island. It‚Äôs only five miles long but it‚Äôs packed with vacation pleasures and adventures. It‚Äôs the perfect island paradise according to travel experts and the famous people who have been Captiva islanders. But mostly it‚Äôs the everyday folks who live on the island and love it who have made it such a legend. They love the funky, laid-back way of life and the conveniences and pleasures that make it a joy ‚Äì the beaches, fishing , sailing as well as golf, tennis, some world famous restaurants and great shops . If you want a vacation in an uncomplicated, down-home place where everybody is a friend and the living is easy you need to go to Captiva. Real estate accommodations are plenty. They can be grande or simple, however you want and some are self-contained such as the South Seas Resort. South Seas Resort The South Seas Resort is a magnificent full service resort that provides any service you need and all the pleasures you want. There are more than 600 units from deluxe hotel rooms to villa suites to three bedroom homes and cottages. It is on 330 acres with 2-1/2 miles of gorgeous white sand beach and convenient to the village shops and restaurants. There are amenities galore ‚Äì 13 pools, 6 restaurants, a marina and lots of activities. Beach and pool attendants keep you supplied with chairs and towels. Boat rentals let you feed that adventure bug. It‚Äôs the kind of vacation paradise you just don‚Äôt want to leave. It can‚Äôt be beat and Gopher Enterprises will help you find the unit that‚Äôs right for you. Gopher Enterprises When you rent your vacation accommodations on Captiva you get more than a place to rest your head. You get a quaint island culture , a special place that gives you memories of wonderful adventures and unique experiences. It leaves you with that ‚Äúdo I have to go home‚Äù feeling. Gopher Enterprises is expert in helping you find that special place. They are the first local company to establish a rental service and they have been successfully helping vacationers for over 30 years. They handle the details so you can handle the fun. Their success is rewarded by the number of families who return to them year after year for their caring and skillful service. Call them. Let them help you and experience the Gopher quality.
